meanings.sent1: The loud music upstirred the crowd at the concert.
meanings.sent2: She upstirred the sleepy cat by gently petting it.
meanings.sent3: The magician upstirred the audience's excitement with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent4: His speech upstirred a sense of patriotism in the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked cookies upstirred memories of childhood.

meanings.definition: The act of stirring up or causing commotion
meanings.sent1: The upstirring of emotions in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent2: The upstirring of the bees caused chaos in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected announcement created an upstirring among the students.
meanings.sent4: The upstirring of gossip spread quickly through the small town.
meanings.sent5: The upstirring of the wind signaled an approaching storm.
